Ok, I believe its not recognizing the dri=
ver. I'm using the mysql
supported JDBC driver thats wrapped in a jar file.=
 Its manual says to
add the path to jar file into CLASSPATH like this:
expo=
rt set CLASSPATH=3D/path/mysql-connector-java-[ver]-bin.jar:$CLASSPATH
Sinc=
e I don't have admin rights on the system, I'm using the Java
thats extract=

ter exporting, it sees the driver and works. When I

hat adding it to CLASSPATH doesn't allow the Java
